elements.name: Name dem Aufgaben
elements.title: Which of the following statements are correct and which are incorrect? Correct the incorrect statements.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Terminations must always be justified in detail.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Correction:
elements.correctAnswer: The terminating party only has to justify the termination in writing if the other party requests this (Art. 335 para. 2 CO).

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Which of the following statements are correct and which are incorrect? Correct the incorrect statements.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: An employer learns that one of his employees belongs to a free church. He may therefore lawfully dismiss her.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Correction:
elements.correctAnswer: Such a termination is made for abusive reasons and is therefore unlawful (Art. 336 CO).

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Which of the following statements are correct and which are incorrect? Correct the incorrect statements.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: A pregnant employee may not be dismissed, but may be dismissed as soon as her child is born.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Correction:
elements.correctAnswer: The blocking period, during which termination is not permitted, lasts until 16 weeks after the birth (Art. 336c para. 1 lit. c. CO).

elements.name: panel3
elements.title: Which of the following statements are correct and which are incorrect? Correct the incorrect statements.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: If an employee has successfully challenged their unfair dismissal, they may resume work at their previous place of work.

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Correction:
elements.correctAnswer: Abusive dismissal also terminates the employment relationship; the dismissed person is only entitled to compensation (Art. 336b CO).

elements.name: panel4
elements.title: Which of the following statements are correct and which are incorrect? Correct the incorrect statements.

elements.name: question9
elements.title: An employee has been working for her employer for six months when she falls ill. After she is still unable to return to work after two months, the employer can legally dismiss her.
